text: The 1985 Women's Junior World Handball Championship was the fifth edition of the tournament which took place in South Korea from 19 to 30 October 1985. Fifteen teams competed in the competition from three continents with only Spain debuting in the competition. Ivory Coast was meant to compete in the competition but had to withdraw. The gold medal went to the defending champions in the Soviet Union who claimed their fourth title after defeating South Korea by three goals in the final. Poland finished in third after defeating East Germany in second overtime. ==First round== ===Group A=== \---- \---- ===Group B=== \---- \---- \---- \---- \---- ===Group C=== \---- \---- \---- \---- \---- ===Group D=== \---- \---- \---- \---- \---- ==Second round== ===Group I=== \---- \---- \---- \---- \---- \---- \---- \---- ===Group II=== \---- \---- \---- \---- \---- \---- \---- \---- ===Thirteenth place=== \---- \---- ==Placement matches== ===Eleventh place game=== ===Ninth place game=== ===Seventh place game=== ===Fifth place game=== ===Third place game=== ===Final=== ==Ranking== The final rankings from the 1985 edition: {|class=wikitable style="text-align:center;" |- !Rank !!width=180|Team |- |Image:Gold medal icon.svg |align=left| |- |Image:Silver medal icon.svg |align=left| |- |Image:Bronze medal icon.svg |align=left| |- |4 |align=left| |- |5 |align=left| |- |6 |align=left| |- |7 |align=left| |- |8 |align=left| |- |9 |align=left| |- |10 |align=left| |- |11 |align=left| |- |12 |align=left| |- |13 |align=left| |- |14 |align=left| |- |15 |align=left| |} == References == == External links == Women's Junior World Handball Women's Junior World Handball Championship, 1985 1985 Junior Handball Category:Women's handball in South Korea
